docs.lead_paragraph: The population of older Americans is growing faster than ever and living longer than ever, but not as long as in much of Europe and elsewhere in the developed world, according to "Older Americans 2010: Key Indicators of Well-Being," a report compiled by 15 federal agencies.

headline.main: Old Age in America, by the Numbers

docs.abstract: A new report paints a statistical portrait of aging Americans.
docs.snippet: A new report paints a statistical portrait of aging Americans.

docs.lead_paragraph: For several years now and with a growing messianic fervor, physicians and health care experts have been responding to the need to deliver more efficient and better primary care with one response: patient-centered medical homes. Not long ago, I found myself doing the same with a friend who prides himself on being a well-informed patient. But instead of an overwhelmingly enthusiastic or even mildly interested response, my friend stared at me blankly.

headline.main: Putting Patients at the Center of the Medical Home

docs.abstract: Doctor and Patient blog discusses lack of patient involvement in newer theories of care like patient-centered medical homes; Scientist at Work blog describes rough ride across terrain of Kenya on way to Ethiopia to study birds and climate change (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated: As insurers try to steer more patients to doctors deemed less expensive and/or judged to provide better care, the companies are coming under increasing criticism from physicians and medical organizations questioning the accuracy of these evaluations.

headline.main: Medical Groups Criticize Insurers on Rating Doctors

docs.abstract: Should the methods used by insurance companies to rate doctors be made more public and be uniform?
docs.snippet: Should the methods used by insurance companies to rate doctors be made more public and be uniform?

docs.lead_paragraph: "Ask an Expert" is a recurring feature on Bucks where you have the opportunity to question big-brained individuals about a particular area of personal finance or consumer affairs.
docs.abstract: Our Medicare expert answers reader questions about what to expect with Medicare when you are retired and turning 65, the options for Medicare coverage of heart attack complications and when you can consult a doctor who isn't accepting new Medicare patients.
